text:
The memcpy function copies a number of bytes from one memory location to another.
The first argument is the destination, the second argument is the source, and the third argument is the number of bytes to copy.
The strlen function returns the length of a string, not including the null terminator.
The + 1 is to include the null terminator in the copy.
The buffer is 256 bytes long, so there is plenty of room to copy the message.
